conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
Process A to B is isochoric (constant volume).
Process B to C is isobaric (constant pressure).
Work done for A to B is zero since volume is constant.
Work done for B to C is calculated as 200 J.
Internal energy change for an ideal gas depends only on temperature change.
State A: P_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 x 10^-3 m^3, T_A = 300 K.
State B: P_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate T_B using ideal gas law.
State C: P_C = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate T_C using ideal gas law.
Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
For A to B, ΔU_AB = nC_v (T_B - T_A) and Q_AB = ΔU_AB.
For B to C, ΔU_BC = nC_v (T_C - T_B) and Q_BC = ΔU_BC + W_BC.
Total heat transferred Q_AC = Q_AB + Q_BC.
Need specific heat capacity C_v and number of moles n for exact value.
